The biggest mistake people make when igniting a Tryn is igniting him when he starts his ult. You gotta wait as long as possible before igniting him. His ult lasts 5 seconds. Ignite him after around 4 seconds. At level 18, for example, Tryn will heal 300 damage, reduced to 150 by Ignite. Ignite does 410 damage, or 328 damage after considering his ult will absorb the first tick. Even if he's chugging potions, without additional help from allies he *will* die.

Similarly, at level 6:

* Tryn heals 190, reduced to 95 by ignite. Health potions heal 5 health per second when chugged (reduced from 10 health a second) -> ~20 extra healing. Total = 115
* Ignite deals 170 damage, reduced to 136 when his ult absorbs the first tick. 

Tryn literally cannot survive a late ignite unless he has a heal/shield from a team mate. Or unless he's building full AP Tryn.

If you're going to die before you can ignite that late, then don't bother igniting.

Of course, Exhaust is more effective against Tryn than ignite, so consider taking that instead if it's a particularly difficult matchup.

If he doesn't get on top of someone squishy with his E almost immediately he's pretty easy to kite in a teamfight situation. Any kind of bruiser than can build frozen heart/randuins will fair better than most. Nasus and Jax both can completely screw him at most points in the game, as can irelia post lvl 3 (very tricky early). He can't really teamfight well vs most team comps that have even a smidge of disengage.  If you're in low elo like me, play someone who can out scale and out-push him; beat him at his own game.
